question.title: How to generate APK and install it on Android Emulator using Android Studio?
question.body:
I'm building an Android app using Android Studio (Electric Eel) on Windows 10. I'm new to Android development.

I want to:

  1. Generate an APK file for my app
  2. Deploy it to the Android Emulator for testing

Here’s what I’ve done so far:

  • Clicked on Build > Build Bundle(s) / APK(s) > Build APK
  • APK was generated in app/build/outputs/apk/debug/app-debug.apk

Now I want to install this APK on the emulator.

I tried:

  • Drag and drop the APK into the emulator window → it says "App not installed"
  • Used the command: adb install app-debug.apk → got error: INSTALL_FAILED_VERSION_DOWNGRADE

How do I properly install the APK to emulator? Also, is there a better way to test my app?

Environment:

  • Android Studio Electric Eel
  • Emulator: Pixel 5, API 31
  • Language: Java

i have got error failed build apk

question_comments.body: Why not just press the Play button in Android Studio? As for the INSTALL_FAILED_VERSION_DOWNGRADE error; you apparently have a newer version of the app installed on that emulator already, so you'll have to uninstall that version first (adb uninstall your.package.name).
